  • City: FORT WORTH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Plastic drum was found in QA damage area wrapped in a thick plastic bag, then moved to Hazmat cage. Upon inspection top of bucket was soiled. Shipping labels were ruined. No active leakage was seen during inspection but evidence of leakage was seen around the larger round closure on top and some small streaks were seen on the side damaging some of the labeling.

item.title: Report E-2024060586
item.description:
Report E-2024060586

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: SANGER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 17, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and adjacent cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged pail in one (1) 30-gallon drum. LSH personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060567
item.description:
Report E-2024060567

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 14, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of resin solutiion was leaking due to shipper error and released approximately ten (10) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum of product into one (1) 95-gallon drum. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2024060574
item.description:
Report E-2024060574

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 14, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3264 was punctured and released approximately thirty-five (35) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH deployed absorbents to the impacted trailer and concrete surfaces. All impacted absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite for disposal. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024060654
item.description:
Report X-2024060654

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found in QA damage area in a repack box. Shipping and diamond labels were taped to the new box. The word "damaged" was written on outer box. Original box is missing. Inner box containing 2 of the 4 plastic bottles was wet in the corner. 1 bottle outside of the inner box had a loose cap. The other bottle next to it was wet near the cap. Bottles were still mostly full.

  • Description: Again, no source could be located for the cause of the leakage. The bottles (2 of 4) themselves had a lower level of liquid than normal. NO punctures were noted. All caps were tightly screwed. Box's labels and shipper paper envelop had been taped over.

item.title: Report E-2024060483
item.description:
Report E-2024060483

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-25T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, 25-gallons of Ultrasil 76 was released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC was dispatched to assist with clean up. Lone Star Hazmat Response, LLC deployed oil dri and sodium bicarbonate to neutralize the spill. The released product, damaged drum, and oil-dri was placed into an 85-gallon poly drum and 55-gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

Due to these factors, the SDS for a potassium hydroxide, solutions was used from Ecolab.

item.title: Report E-2024060438
item.description:
Report E-2024060438

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 11, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1760 had a faulty valve and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Resolute Environmental & Response Services, LLC (RERS) to remediate the site. RERS closed the valve preventing any further leakage. RERS then wiped down all totes and deployed soda ash to the affected areas and swept them in using hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.
